name: Aura Kingdom
description: Aura Kingdom is a free-to-play Anime MMORPG featuring strong PVE elements, a uniquely detailed world, and an engaging, well-crafted story. Aura Kingdom empowers players as Envoys of Gaia, gifted individuals that take the role of one of the thirteen classes.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7 (32bit/64bit), Windows 8 Processor: Intel Pentium4 2.8 GHz or better; AMD K8 2600 or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: nVidia GeForce 6600 or better; ATI Redeon X1600 or better DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 6 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7 (32bit/64bit), Windows 8 Processor: Intel Core2 Duo 2.66 GHz or equivalent; AMD Athlon 64 X2 6000 or equivalent Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: nVidia GeForce 9500 or equivalent; ATI Radeon HD2600 or equivalent DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 6 GB available space

I've played tis game since beta through the aeria ignite.  so my steam game record time isn't much Server Hydra, Now Phoenix.  Be warned, tis game is extremely laggy even if you have a godly spec pc the game itself is broken, everyday on the 5am daily ranking update ( also the centurion sched ) there will be a massive server delay that will last from 3 - 15 minutes and another warning is for the random account banning that aeria does originally intended for bots but now they just ban anyone with no reason.  The game was good before the invasion of bot army started,  now 6 out of 10 people you would meet in game are basically bots,  added to that whatever's left of the original community are a bunch of elitist that won't accept under leveled newbies in high lvl dungeon runs ( lvl 70+ dungeon raids ) and people nowadays are mostly leeches that asks to be carried ( though if you plan to invest a lot of effort in the game and be able to overpower dungeons, people will instead flock to you like little maggots pretending to be friends ^o^ )  In terms of PVP forget it, if you're a newbie just starting out and has gotten curious about it chances are the moment you enter arena you will be used as a farming mob by veteran players who will tab away from fully geared players ( especially cancer types ) and will continually aim for undergeared low level enemies. 95% of arena fanatics are like that and the remaining 5% are those who are truely skilled in making build ups and are always noted as quit on sight. ( Quit the match they will eat you alive )   Well, If you do however manage to find a nice welcoming guild with senpai's who are willing to help you out, you will find that this game is really wonderful to play, the anime style graphics that allows you to peek at your own toons pantsu... oops i mean the fast pace style of the game will surely keep you coming back for more, despite that some people had stated that the repetitive grinding is one of the biggest turn down, i would like to differ by saying as a warbow i loved the way on how i was able to kite so many mobs, running while shooting them with movement speed of 200 same could be said in playing wizards and gunslingers. i love kiting.  Overall despite a bot army and terrible human community plus insane server lag, i would still recommend Aura Kingdom  ( purely because of the loli's and waifu's ) for it has a fun and fulfilling style of gameplay. I've only been playing this game for a small time now, but from the moment I actually got into the game I noticed a few things that I want to note about this game. Of course this is a limited view as of right now, and I'll probably right more on this game in the future, but there are just things from a new player that I'd like to discuss that are appealing and absolutely not.  1. CAMERA DIRECTION. The camera is fixed, and not on the direction that your character is running, which is common in practically 99% of RPG games you and I could probably think of off the top of our heads. You have to hold down the right mouse button and manually steer around where your view is. This can be considered an infuriating experience at first. It also completely ruins the flow of the game, adventure, and just kinda sticks it more into your head that this is a program instead of your own cool anime adventure.   Even when it feels like I've gotten used to it, I end up in situations where this absolute design flaw sticks out like a sore thumb.  2. QUESTS OBJECTIVE TRACKING. While we're on the topic of that feeling of adventure that a lot of people would consider crucial for an RPG, myself included, the game has a function that can completely destroy the sense of adventure and exploration in quests. How? Well I'll start off by saying that any good RPG has a way to track the general destination or area that you have to go to for your quest, through just a little symbol that appears on the map or a symbol that appears generally on the top of the screen that points you where to go (note: in some games this can be executed poorly, however there are also games that can do this while still giving a lot of sense of adventure, Skyrim is a good example).   This game, however, has a pop-up screen that displays the goals of the quest, and if you click on the sentences of these obective (e.g you have to kill 5 of a certain enemy), the game will not only lay out a sparkly trail on the ground that not only leads to your goal, but also automatically starts taking you there. If you needed to find people that you can tell are supposed to be hard to find, you can just click this and you'll just be taken to them. More hidden resources that needed to be found? No worry, you'll be taken to it instantly.   For some, this is quite the positive, since a lot of people would find having to always look for the quest's objectives manually each time tedious and tiring; and it's a completely optional too. Honestly it's a pretty convenient function for people that just wanna blast through to get to the higher levels.   Although the bad thing I'll have to say about it is that the icon on the mini-map in the top right-hand of the screen the icons were absolutely confusing. There is a lot going on, and the icon that displays the direction of the quest does not stand out as much as the other symbols. The good thing is, however, that if you go into the regional map there is a list of icons on the side that not only tell you what each is for, but also has an option to not display them! Very handy.   I'd say these functions are honestly up to interpretation for whether they're good or bad. Personally, I find that it's very hard and not as clear as other RPG games in the showing of a more general direction and in frustration, can push you more to the option of just letting the game take you everywhere. I'm all about immersion and for me, even having that option takes away from the potential of the experience of adventure.   3. THE DESIGNS AND ITEMS. My god, everything is cool in this game. As an artist, aesthetics and the way colours and design catch the eye are very important to me for just about everything; especially in anything that's definitely more visual-based like games. But I've caught myself thinking quite a few times that it's overwhelming in this game, and even a bit 'too cool'.   Generally when we start to play a new fantasy MMORPG we start off with these kinda mediocre and mundane gear. In some you can see how it's kinda cool, but it's definitely not awe-inspiring. Especially compared to high-level players that you see running around mounted on something crazy like a lion with a fire mane, and gear on them that is radiating with some awesome aura, with wings coming out the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ back. We look to these players and start to idolize them in a sense for looking so rad. And when you start to reach up closer to the top, and start to collect your own cooler items, you definitely start to get a sense of pride and accomplishment in the hard work you've put into developing your character so much, especially if you paid money for it.   This game off the bat gives you awesome items. For exmaple I choose the Scythe class for my first character, at a very early level I can summon not one, but THREE beautifully designed demons to accompany me; and the choice is out of six demons in total. Even if you didn't choose the Scythe class, under level 10 you are given a mount, which personally I've never witnessed in a fantasy MMORPG before.  And to top it all off, the game itself is actually based around the lore of it's world that there are these people chosen by destiny, that are given little creature companions (which is a very stereotypical thing to see in anime) that help you fight with their special abilities. While in character creation you get to choose out of four which one you want.   This trait in the game is also really up to interpretation just like the last one, too. On one hand, it's very rad that we all can have so many magnificent items, and can just look so fine. But on the other hand, it personally gives me less of an urgent want to progress fastly to be able to look good since I already am satisfied with my gear. Also on the more negative side, town centers were lots of players congregate can look completely ridiculous; like a hub for really over the top, overpowered original characters from deviantArt. And despite actually loving all the designs in this game, I still feel more neutral about it all.   4. LAG. The bane of all gamers out there, the insufferable force which destroys the natural flow and order in your gaming session - yes, ladies, gentlemen, and honoured guests - this game has so, so much lag. I don't believe I have to go into such extensive detail for this section, but it's so much that it DOES need to be noted. It's not so bad that it crashes my game or makes me lag for more then 10 seconds, but I do have a good laptop and internet.   Why so much lag though? Honestly, blame the dirty weabs. All there for the designs, I swear.   5. POP-UP CONVERSATION SCENES. In this game when you talk to anyone that isn't a background character a pop-up screen with your character's and the npc's top half of the body show up. Dialogue, actions each character makes shown in text, intervention from not only your first mount, but also your little companion that's always given to you... it's all just like a visual novel. And it's very appealing, and even refreshing and unique to see in a fantasy MMORGP.   It wouldn't be too much of a stretch that they put this in to appeal to those that are loyal anime fans, seeing as a lot of very popular games in Japan have these kinds of cut scenes that are very iconic in visual novels. They even give your character very over-exaggerated reactions that intergrate into the 'weaboo sub-popculture'.   I can imagine some people would find this cringe-worthy, but I doubt anyone that would see it like that would be interested in a blantantly obvious anime-inspired game in the first place.   6. CLASSES. I was going to write about this extensively, but I ran out of space, so here's the basics. There are a wide range of classes, up to 13 classes in total.   I'd recommend this game since most features that I see as note-worthy are more postive or up to interpretation, and therefore, worth giving a go and seeing if it's for yourself!

I was in Aura Kingdom from 1st CBT. And I'm still there. People who will write the game is 'boring' are the ones that most of the times leaves the game because the boss 1 hit them in dungeons. So let's start with   PROS:  - Cute to the core ( And by that...I mean it, the official screenshot shows only like 10% of game cuteness) - PANTSU! ( Yes that also goes in pros >:) ALOT of pantsu in this game!) - Huge world with loads of zones and beautiful landscape you never seen in any mmorpg before - Music... soundtracks are pretty into the feeling of the world and dungeons - ALIVE game world ( This is not a game where you will see few players running around and all NPC's are standing in place. Game world is really alive, Npc's are walking around, talking to each others and doing stuff) - Rich playerbase, there are loads of players there in this game. Wherever you are, there will be someone near you most of the times - Really much to do: Main storyline quests (to the lvl 60 atm but they will exceed it soon), loads of sidequests that gives achivements, daily quests, Dungeons you can play Solo, in party or hell mode that is kinda hardcore, after lvl 60 you can register and enter Sky Tower (100 floors? dungeon) on weekends and do Otherworld dungeons in what you can find really rare and expensive gears or items - Eidolons... Pets that will heal you, deal damage and bring you stuff if you link them. There is ALOT of them to collect. Catch them all! :D - Blacksmiting and Alchemy, one word, Crafting - Paragon Table, like lootery with rich prizes - FREE 2 PLAY! And it is! Whoever will tell you game is P2W or P2P is an noob. You can basicaly get ANYTHING for ingame currency or for Loyalty Points. Loyalty points shop is like Item Mall (Item mall is for Cash only), but you get Loyalty points in game while doing sidequests and stuff... - Players can set up Stalls ( It's like players market stuff) and sell their loot that way, or they can deposit items in Auction - Level capacity is 75 and leveling becomes intense after lvl 50 ( I was thinking should i put this on Pros or Cons.. And i decided to put it in pros since when you reach max lvl... Well you should discover yourself why) - Rich character progression, Evony path, stats lvls, masteries and more - For paying players thwere is Tiered spender with rare and most expensive rewards - Guild levels, guilds have their own cities (guild halls) where their guild members can meet up. Guild system is made way better than in other mmo's - Costumes and acessories gives you stats boosts - You can recolor your custom costumes with loads of colors - Nice character customization So... thoose are PROS, I might have more of them but I can't remember all of them :D And now on  CONS:  - Bots... Oh yes~ The game is populated with thoose guys too. But they don't affect so much of your gameplay. Just running around...minding their own - Lag... This one is not much noticable but sometimes, if you're having slow internet you will feel it. It might result in disconnections sometimes and in damage delay that might result death of your char in fights. - PvP is really gear, class and armor and weapon fortification relied. Yes, If you are level 40 or 50 and thinking about going into PvP instances...Forget it. You will die by 1 hit from lvl 60 or higher players who are fully geared and their armors and weapons are fortificated. If you wanna be PvPer here, you will at least need to spend some time getting thoose gears and fortify armor that matches your class.  Also there could be more CONS, you might like and dislike something and our oppinions might be different but remember, You are a new player and this is a review of someone who is in the game for a long time :) Long enough that can see why this game is actually 100% worth to play ^^ But make sure you go little over minimum system requirements because game will really test your PC hardcore :)

There is a lot to do every day, so it is diffcult to get bored.  The downsides to this game though is that and this is my biggest one, is that every class, EVERY class is OP, especially if you get dual blades, or shield and sword then you break the game. Which this kind of takes a good chunk of fun out of it, when you can solo field bosses with zero difficulty.   I reccomend it but if your looking for something more challenging, youll get bored quick.

This game is beautiful, it's got great anime style graphics and an amazing set of armour and clothing choices.  10/10 for graphics.  8/10 for game optimization 5/10 for difficulty and 10/10 for gameplay.  This game in a whole is worth playing, it's fun in short. It's a /Extremely/ easy game for all to play. I played it for 11 hours and got from level 1 - level 42, I had a create time conversing with the commuinity of the game and fighting my way through the typical sort of mmo questing sysetem. The dungeons are probably the best bit of this game, especially the bits of seen for hell-mode. The dungeons are insane, so much colours and things going on at once you really feel like you're controlling some sort of really OP anime character.  Pro's-  -F2P and a very good F2P model at that. -Beautiful world to explore.  -A great anime style; probably the best yet. -Fun gameplay. -A lot of the quests are completely opptional it won't /make/ you pay for anything to get along in the game. -Easy, this could be good or bad depending on your opinion.  Con's-  This is going to be the biggest thing I'm going to raise, because it's what made me stop playing. -The AP store, the place where you use real money to buy in game things, not important things that give you an advantage over anyone else, just mounts, costumes, random things...AND THE F**KING SUBCLASS CHANGE. That's right, being a 'Noob' to this game I had know idea that you're supposed to take a certain subclass taht went well with the first class you had, it would be fine if this change costed in game currency or a small amount of loyalty points. BUT NO. it costs  !!!£20!!! For something that small but still something so drastic and needed for the gameplay, for this single thing the developers get!  0/10! EA STATUS.  -The game is your typical mmo. Kill 9 of these, then hand in the quest. It's normally okay though since it's masked by the beautiful gameplay. -The music was ♥♥♥♥, sorry people but yes. The same soundtrack...Over & over...Just...ugh. -PvP is completely one sided, it's no wonder barley anyone does it, Gunslingers rule the battlefield. -Not much end game content. The extent of what you do is farm to get the best mounts and costumes.  In short, this game is great. Just be careful of the choices you make sometimes...Because the developers are gonna make you pay big.  This game get's 7/10

I enjoyed Eden Eternal (another game by Aeria Games). Aura Kingdomes is the inproved version of that game. It is stroy driven and you cna play it solo for the most part. It has a cooldown system, meaning there is no mana involved, which is a huge + for me, because i allways forget to pop the mana pots. The combat is fluid, fast and nice to watch. And all bosses and even some normal mobs have AOE moves that you can dodge by actually walking out of them. You can also fly at any time. You get upgraded mounts as the game progreses. You also get costumes that all look different every 5-10 levels (as quest items). In daily quests you get costumes aswell and they last foerever and aren't 3-day costumes (you can get those too tho).  Overall i recommend the game and since i used to play mmo's a lot in the past this one is refreshing to play, because it's simply a blast to play.

Overall fun game to play and is not very difficult to get into. Most the time your character will be auto walking to the next main objective, which is nice if you're out to play casually. I have yet to make it end game as i am lvl 44 and this review will be edited until then.   Pros:   -Class system that involves class combos with special skills as the result of it -Simple rewards system for doing sidequests which can give you some nice gear -Cash shop seems to be mostly cosmetic  -Crafting your own consumables for dungeons!  Cons:  -Not all classes can be mixed, only certain class combos get special skills out of it which makes it feel like you would have to follow this combo only. Although it is somewhat understandable.  -Cash shop points from buying seem to be really low...im kinda surprised at how much a character slot expansion costs.  -Starts to get very repititive, after a while it just gets kinda boring auto walking. The quests range from 'kill these guys' to 'kill these guys to get a certain item'   Conclusion: Like any other game it is definitely not perfect but it is fun to try out and i would recommend this game for someone who plays to play a laidback game. Playing with friends would make the experience a bit more enjoyable since most people you will run into will not be very chatty or you might just get recruited to a guild instead. I hope to give a full review once i reach endgame or if i dont then i will leave it here and give it another edit.

I thought I'd put in my imput on this game. First off, when looking for an MMO with Anime Graphics and free-roam style... this is so far the only game that has hit the spot. I fell in love and I now have been playing it non-stop for three days, just short of 40 hours now.  TRUE - Players are not overly friendly and do not go out of their way to say Hello or RolePlay (I come from World of Warcraft) so players NOT roleplaying was a little different. FALSE - Players only seek to use you. I've met some very nice people and have joined a guild that is actually reasonably social. Good players are out there, they are just hidden. Hah. TRUE - The Quests are mostly gathering and killing - basic MMO stuff. Still, I love them because if you listen to the story behind them, they actually make sense. In WoW - they say go get some candles. No explanation for why... just go get me some freaking candles. So you do. In this game, your goal is clear and everyone's quests are to help them help you. It makes sense why you go gather mushrooms or kill beetles. TRUE - The AI and BOT models are VERRRRRY overused, but I don't mind it much. As for player models, I haven't seen any close look-alikes and the character creation gives just enough imput.  Other Things I Love? I love classifying in two specializations. So i can use guns and swords, etc. It's very cool and something I was sad they started taking away from World of Warcraft (its basically nonexistant). I love the dungeon system. Dungeons are completely solo-able or you can join up and do a party-version. This makes it easy for SOLO players (like myself) to get everything in the game accomplished without searching for people I don't even want to talk too. The game is easy. Not in the sense that it offers no thrill or excitement, but its not overly complicated. Everything is explained in words first and then (for visual people like myself), most everything has a little video to also explain how each element works. Using Gems is explained, creating armor and gear, and even fishing. Fishing is FUN. Its also one of the easiest places to get Gold (WInk WINk). I Love the Companions - they are fun and sooo helpful. I especially Love Merilee!! Costumes are great - no mismatched ugly gear while you're leveling. The best ones must be bought however (SIGH)  What I Don't Like? No open world RolePlay - but thats ok. Hey, if you want to Look Me Up. I love Roleplay Not a whole lot of servers. Can only create 9 characters, but there are 12 classes [This isn't overly important since they have duel-classification at level 40, so you can make up for lost classes then.] Gold Farming is Slow. And I do mean SLOOOW. I've farmed gold for weeks in several games but I've never had so much difficulty as in this one. In-Game Real Money:: I've always had a problem with this in games. It bothers me that I can't buy nice things with Gold. They have implemented another Currency to get most of these Real Money items, but its a lot of work (almost too much). Still - despite adding this it is in no way PAY to WIN. You don't have to spend any money to be freaking amazing in this game.  I don't if my review helped. But these are some things that I looked at, disliked, loved, and enjoyed.  Overall. Get this Game. If you like RPGs with a GOOD Storyline (who doesnt?), Anime Graphics, and MMO, get this game. People say a lot of crap. But this game has been completely worth it for me. :)

Though I kinda agree with the few reviewers that AERIA indeed has quite slow and awful customer support. I would still recommend you to play this game. There are tons of things that you can do. From Archaeology all the way up to designing your House's interior ( which is a new implementation btw). And lets not forget about the fact, that Aura has a very friendly community. I suppose writing a review for this game is in order.  *Ahem*  Aura Kingdom is a free to play (mmo) game licensed by Aeria Games. During my first week into the game, I was greeted with the traditional anime esc story about how you are the main character and the world revolves around you. Now this being an MMO I grew tired of reading through everyones dialouge and skipped most of the story until I found myself in Navea. Navea is the main hub for players to sell their items, fight players, window shop, etc. Having made my way to lvl 20 and viewing everyone elses cool costumes and items, I found myself looking through the Auction House. I will say this right now... DO NOT spend any money on this game. Every item can be obtained by completing quests or dungeon running, although it will take far longer your wallet will be thanking you in the end.  Now that the fancy costumes are out of the way, we can begin talking about the combat system. Combat in Aura Kingdom is very... spammy? Without knowing any better, you will soon be allocating all your combat points into speed which will reduce the cooldown on all of your abilities. Now with infinite ability spamming, the bosses in this game are a lot easier and reduce the amount of time you spend in dungeons. All in all, the combat system is nice but very broken with the cooldown on all of your abilities... especially the bard class.   Would I recommend the game? Yes. Aura Kingdom is a free to play game with a lot potential but is wasted on broken builds and abilities. However, the world is very fruity and with new patches being released every month or so it makes up for the mistakes that it clearly made.
I love this game... It is a toned down verison of other MMORPG's but it is great for a busy mom and will be a great game to get my oldest son started on.

Looking for a game close enought ot SAO?  Well you've come to the right place, cause Aura Kingdom is only one of those anime themed MMORPGs that is as close to SAO...  Grindy, but worth it. Lots of players (Especially on channel 1 of your chosen server) and a very active community. Weapons are very stylish, but the costume is hard to come by without advancing to get at least a decent Forest Ambassador outfit. There is a currency called Loyalty Points (Accumulated by doing certain daily quests, returning monster bounties, or in valuable chests) and if you continuously do these quests, getting a costume without abiding to microtransaction's tempting offers for the best looking costumes, can be pretty satisfying, include the mounts too which are kinda affordable. Eidolons, the pets which is already registered in your account and can be used by multiple characters depending if they are active on the other character, is very convenient as you won't be grinding hard again if you decide to create a 2nd character, but instead the keys 9which are used to summon them) can be saved to do an evolution for your eidolon. And lastly, I would like to commend the very interesting and versatile sub skill system. In lvl 40, you will be given a quest where you can pick your sub, but worry not, as your sub can be replaced for free!  Overall, I would recommend this to anyone who likes MMORPGs with anime theme and an active community and fun to play dungeons.

This was one of my first MMORPGs, aside from Mabinogi, which was unique and different from other MMOs. And, of course, my newest computer had a sucky graphics card which couldn't - and still can't - run Mabinogi properly. So, I decided to search around and I found this game.  It's fun as hell.  I've gotten to lvl 21 in the timespan of five hours. Very fun times.  The quests are the usual 'Search for X and give it to Y' or 'Kill X amount of Y', but I honestly don't mind that. To me, those kinds of things don't bug me much. The storyline is the major portion of the game for me. And, from what I've seen so far, this storyline isn't half bad. The Eidolons are pretty kickass too.  The classes are unique and cool in their different ways - you have no idea how much I struggled to find the proper one that I really wanted to use. They all have different strengths and weaknesses and they provide the players with different playing styles a chance to succeed as well.  TL;DR - A pretty good MMORPG that I would recommend to my friends. Nothing too out of the ordinary, but still unique in it's own way.

Overall this is an awesome game!   It has a slight learning curve with some of the aspects of the game, but once you get it down it's a lot of fun. You're able to create some cute and colorful characters, the one fall-back with the character creation is the lack of variety. You can pick between 9 faces and 10 hairstyles 12 hair colors and 4 skin tones. This is not really a SMALL amount, until you're in game and notice how many other characters that your same hair style. But the combos they have are very nice and very well done. I would love to see them expand on this in the future.  It is one of those games that you click on the quest and your character starts running to it, making getting to and from your quest spots a breeze, almost too easy. But the combat system is really impressive and has some great animation work. You should put thought into how you're going to build up your character before you start adding attruibute points here or there. You can do a google search on some of the classes and get builds and guides on how to create and lvl your characters. Failure to fo this way will make you find yourself spending a lot of in game currency to reset your stats.  In short, just download the game and jump in feet first....

Quests: 8/10 PVE: 9/10 Fun, High amounts of damage. PVP: Haven't tried it yet but saw some videos online. Customization 8/10 Graphics 9/10 The game is able to stand toe to toe with other MMORPGS and win in certain areas. The most fun part I like is the fact that you are doing 10,000 points of damage in mid levels. Just refreshing to see such big numbers in a game.  Difficulty/Diversity: The game can be easy , medium, hard, impossible. Depending on which dungeon you enter. For the most part PVE is so easy a child can do it, but dungeons can rapidly get tough and some dungeons require multiple players or else its just not doable. Fair enough since that brings people together.  I wish they (and every MMORPG) implemented the market system of atlantica online. Limited inventory and storage slots but you can share warehouse with other heroes so you can 'MULE' alternate characters The game basically succeeded in making GRINDING , entertaining/amusing/fun. But still, grinding is grinding and after your 1,000th kill, you might fall asleep on the keyboard, such is the problem with every MMORPG with grind. But at least the game will make you move through different places and wont allow you to stay too long in one spot due to quest progression so it all works out. Droprates are somehow bad 4/10, hard to farm specific items for crafting etc. Some players suggested that crafting was only for the rich and not for everyone who tries it. Sad since in most games people craft to make the gold.   Overall this game is addicting and the $ Cash Shop isn't as bad. You can move through the game without being limited by it. That is what I have seen so far since I'm level 44. Max level 75 I hear.   They already installed gliding, they should have included FLYING. ... Some things need to be simplified. Seems one more step to becoming one of those chinese clutterfest browser mmorpgs.  I suggest you try it to level 10 and see for yourself. (shouldn't take an hour) Overall I would say this game is 8/10. Atlantica Online is still my 9/10 while Anarchy Online would be 7.5/10 in comparison. A 10/10? I'm still waiting for it.

The quick and dirty:  It's a basic but fun free MMO that I find to be very relaxing to play. The visuals won't tax your video card, but the art is colorful and well crafted, and the environments look great. It also has some very smart features that I haven't seen in any other MMO myself, such as the ability to click a quest step to initiate auto-run to its location.

It's not bad. Legit servers are Pay2Win though, to the point that there's literally no point playing unless you're going to throw $100's at the game. My advice, play on a private server.   As far as the game is concerned it's a generic MMORPG with Korean grindy themes and a Ragnarok Online-style Anime skin. The gameplay is mostly 'mash spacebar' which automatically runs you towards your next objective, followed by 'mash all the F-keys until it dies. Great if you want a brainless slash-em-up for after work but if you wanted something that required more than half a brain then I'd say look elsewhere.   5/10, would be more if there were less bots, less p2w and better gameplay.

Consider this the bible of Aura Kingdom:  Pros:  -Awesome anime-ish graphics -Fast moving real time combat -Awesome looking attack spells -Fully customizable talent tree -A huge array of summons to choose from -Cool character costumes -Easy, but fast fun moving quests -Free mount right at the start of the game -You can que up dungeons from anywhere in the world -Guilds can earn their own castle, where you can do your shopping, crafting, fishing, and various other duties without dealing with the lag of the main town or bots spam. Its actually really cool  Summary: Honestly youll be addicted right at the start. The beginning of the game is loaded to the brim with content and rewards just for even playing the game. Theres even 2 cut scenes that are pretty dope. Easy quests level you super fast and fast beautiful attack spells will have you enthralled just to play your character. Some of the monsters are adorable, and the characters look pretty badass.   Cons  -Way too many bots everywhere. Anytime you enter the main town, your inbox is spammed with gold sellers -Quests offer no challenge. Way too easy. Most times this is fine, but having a challenge once in awhile would be nice. There are literally quests where they ask you to talk to an object right next to the quest giver and then reward you with like 20-50% of your level in exp. Because of this, you level psychotically fast in the beginning  -PVP is the worst of any game I've ever played. Too many rich players with nothing better to do than twink out low level characters and camp low level pvp harassing new/poor players endlessly. It makes pvp not fun at all. You literally cant do anything because they just camp the spawn point and kill you in 1 hit. Theres no challenge or fun here. Just instant death with no gameplay in between. Absolutely stupid. Its so bad that the majority of the community ends up quitting out of frustration or bordom since PVP is the only thing there is to do at high levels -Theres only 1 raid dungeon and youre only allowed to go in it at the most inconvenient time possible: Saturday night (when most people are out having a life). Honestly its the dumbest raiding system ever created imo. It does not take into account that players are on different time zones or anything -Rich players dominate the raids and wont even allow poor players to join. You literally have to beg or find someone nice enough to let you join them on their raid if you ever want a shot -There are no high level quests, yet the level cap is 80. Quests stopped around 55-60 and youre just supposed to grind dungeons nonstop after that for exp because they turn off monster exp to stop bots. -Updates come horrifically slow like most asia ported mmorpgs. In fact its quite stupid, because they ported the game with no end game content, so basically the level cap is higher than the game content available (as i mentioned before).  -Some classes are completely useless and offer no competitive gameplay or real use  -End game is too gear dependant and rewards rich players for spending real money way too much -Many of the eidelons in the game are unatainable to normal players unwilling to spend money on cash shop -Eidelons (summons) are insanely hard to get. Like ridiculously luck dependant. You have to farm them endlessly with a small small chance of getting them as a pet. After months of play i never even got one from just pure horrible luck. Luckily, you can buy a few of them with dungeon points (ALOT of points) -Many costumes are unatainable unless willing to spend on cash shop -End game is terrible. Just plain terrible and will leave you so bored you just want to make a new char to have fun again  Summary: This game is frustrating. There are simple things that could be fixed to completely 180 the game to a better place, but they refuse to fix them. Such as PVP. I am an avid pvper in games, and the fact that I cant pvp because of rich people 1 shotting ungeared players turns me off to this game. Its not just a matter of farming for gear. You have to use the upgrade system and spend countless money to get gear good enough to survive and do damage. Unfortunately the amounts required, require having a maxed out character and spending real life cash on the cash shop, or farming like a bot for months to save. It sucks. End game is trash. Theres only 1 raid dungeon and youre dependant on overgeared players letting you run with them on 1 night a week. yes, its only open once. Also, the quests stop around level 55, so you have to grind like an idiot in dungeons the rest of the way until they port more content over. I actually quit playing last year because of this and only recently started up again because they started finally bringing the higher level quests

I played already about 100h in this game before steam release, so I'd like to share some impressions:  -QUESTS (which game doesn't have them?): the main source of exp. Personally before playing Aura Kingdom I wasn't a real fan of this kind of stuff. The quests' requirements in other mmos where pretty long to achieve (kill 100 mobs, collect 60 quest items) with not that great profit; in AK the numbers are greatly reduced so you can end quests faster, you gain usually a great amount of exp and most important for me you have more a filling of making 'progress'. Also this means more quests to do (before getting bored) = more exp.  -GRINDING: you need something? go, take it. One of the most usefull things in this game, is that you can see the complete list of stuff that a mob can possibly drop, and those who are 'grinding addicted' like me, won't spend too much time to find what they need. The problem is that some items (key fragments specially) drops from unique mobs that also have a very low drop rate. About items there's something to specify: most of the items binds when equipped, so take a moment to think if you want to keep it or you want to sell it. If you tend to buy items, like usually happens in other mmos selling becomes Indispensable. Other thing is that a lot of stuff is untradeable, and if it have a tradeable version, the price will be Veeeeery high.  -PARTY: need a party for a quest or a dungeon? no problem. The party finder works like a lobby in a FPS game. P.S.: if you are a bard sometimes you even don't have to look for a party that people will ask you to join. P.P.S.: if you are a gunslinger (like me) most of the time you will be kicked without a word at least 'till lvl 45-50. ('_') . . . ..bye...(>'_'),(>'_'),(>'_')  -PVP ARENA: 10vs10= turret defence, 50vs50= wars, and more. Every day at specific hours pvp arena opens. You can join wherever you are but be fast 'cause the queue fills up quickly. When you understand how your character works, you can start to be competitive pretty early starting from lvl 45. Most important thing to me is that, if you want to become a great pvp player, it depends only on your efforts in game. There's no Over-Powered Cash Shop weapons or armors. Cash Shop is mainly for aesthetics, and in any case they can be found in game with some effort. You can also buy in the cash shop spending Loyalty Points. LPs are awarded in game by completing quests or winning prices in pvp arena.  -DUNGEONS: kill,kill,kill,kill,KILL. Essentially those are straightline-runs where you annihilate everything you encounter with more and more bosses to defeat with the game progression. You can clean them with your skills and fill like a badass or make things harder by joining a party and transform your run in a slaughterhouse apocalypse. Here you will find more drops, more unique, more exp than normal grinding, money and stronger and stronger and stronger bosses.  This is the main stuff, the rest is up to you :)

Aura Kingdom level 1-30 (A review of the first ten hours,considering most players will not go beyond that)  Pros -Charm: Charm is often the deciding factor between a good and bad game, as it is charm is what causes you to adore the characters and the world and want to come back for more, something i feel Aura kingdom posseses.  -Stunning graphics/art style- the game looks bright and beautiful on my lowish- end pc, and the charming cartoony art style is one thing that makes the game. (better than the average mmo and vastly better than most of theese next gen titles with there 'realistic' graphics/style - an art style i feel is incredibly overused and am getting very sick of) -Nice Soundtrack (slightly cheap instrument presets but it is well composed) -Charming Story with resonable variety. Sure, most of the time its not exactly a emotional rollercoaster, but i enjoy its diversity and charm. Theres supply missions, Combat missions, instances,sneak missions and missions to play as other characters. Hidden quests and board quests are actually rewarding unlike many mmos as you can get cool costume items and rare misc items that cost quite a bit from the loyalty shop. -A resonable Free 2 Play Model, everything can be bought through in game currency and there seems to be few restrictions on area and quest access, unlike most f2p mmos. Of course paying real money gets you the cool stuff quick but they gotta make money somehow. -lots of cool little features unique to this mmo such as being able to glide and jump really high from the start, custom guild logos, cinematic finisher moves, hidden quests and so on. -No grinding up levels to complete the main quest (at least in the first 10 hours) which is a nice change from some mmos where you can have to level up 10 levels just to continue the main story. -the variety of costumes and hats, though hard to get, make customization fun. -The decision to opt for text based dialogue is actually a plus for me because i much prefer it to the terrible voice acting i have heard in other mmos such as WildStar. -Game is around a year old and still updated -There are a couple of big servers which have nice populations, which a nice change from the many mmos that are now like ghost towns such as LOTRO. -Steam Trading cards - reminds many players including me of our favorite fantasy animes such as Sword art online (though it is still very different to most of these)  Cons -really cheesy romance system where you can go round kissing random people on the server and giving them chocolate -Lots of unnecesary ♥♥♥♥♥♥ clothing, along with characters and companions designed to attract horny male teenagers which are completely unnecesary, and some really cringy loading screens and npcs which seem to almost promote Paedophilia. -Newer updates have led to significant latency issues even with a good internet connection and fastish pc -Awkard camera and silly control system (luckily the control system can be changed but the camera still irritates me) -Huge array of graphical and general glitches aka getting stuck in walls, missing dialogue from conversations, blurry faces, Characters who you cannot speak to and so on (hopefully they will be fixed in time) -A huge array of irritating trade bots which jam up chat. -And my biggest criticism of the game: The same character models for human npcs are used over and over again. Most mmos manage to vary vary the colour of the clothes, the hair and so on and the different combinations mean few npcs who arent enemies are replicas, yet Aura kingdom seems to have this at a minimum, meaning that sometimes when you go into a different town you just feel like your speaking to the same people again. -minimal pvp options -many features are locked untill lvl 30 -Aeria games have a reputation for ruining good games, however they have not ruined Aura Kingdom so far.  So overall i would strongly recommend downloading Aura kingdom and playing it for at least a couple of hours, and if you dont like it, well no money has been wasted. Sure its flawed, but in my opinion the charm and great content shines through it. This is the first 2014/2015 game which hasnt been a dissapointement to me.  8.8/10 Great.

8/10 Stars  I try to be unbiased when writing reviews for games around here in STEAM especially because this is where I can tell people if the game is great or not. Well, in my opinion this game is worth the check. The game has a lot of places to explore and a fairly large player base of RPGMMO players who love the game. When I started out I had no clue what to do or what to expect. So I kindly asked around for help and guidance and man did I get the best community treatment Ive had yet. The players welcomed me with open arms and attended to my needs. When I had problems with quests or overall the game itself the people were kind enough to join my party and help out in my quest even though they had better things to do. The player base in this game is really amazing and kind from my experience and Ive got to give them credit for that, because if a game like this has a kind player base that tends to help other players who just started out then sign me up! It sure beats the Xbox Live community of 8 year olds screaming '360 NO SCOPE!!!' at the top of their lungs whenever I hit a trickshot and then calls me a hacker -_-  So you might be wondering about the overall gameplay mechanics and core gameplay right? Well here is my initial reaction to it. For the gameplay I found the settings to be 'Tweakable' this means that you can basically move things like the move counters, character health bar, Quest Box, Item Box, ETC in a way so that it wont hinder you or stop you from seeing the amazing scenery that this anime-ish MMORPG successfully shows you. Moving on to the core gameplay I found that the experience is what you would find in any MMORPGs nowadays. I admit its pretty generic due to the fact that you are called a 'Hero' and you must find your true purpose is kind of already played out since about a million other people have been told the same, but lets move on with our lives and forget the fact that you arent special in this game. The maps are well designed and the monster AI is intuitive at most. In fact I can say that the monsters or enemies in this game are pretty well balanced and are reactive to the players attacks. Therefore this game brings out what it promised at most which is a anime-ish MMORPG aimed at people like me who want to play something that resembles a JRPG but without all the complicated add ons that World Of Warcraft has. Plus, this game is literally FREE so yeah...I gave my wallet some relief there.  BUT! we all know there is a flaw for every game ever made. For Aura Kingdom I think its pretty clear that the pros of this game is pretty visible. It has the fancy graphics, textures, and plot to draw any anime fan or a RPG fan in the mix while maintaining a simple and easy to use interface that almost everyone can use. However, the flaws in my opinion is the latency issues that occur when you havent logged on for a while or if you have a weak connection. When having a weak connection you get a lot of un-rendered textures and areas in the map that doesnt even show up. Also, I should point out that even if this game has a large player base that is supportive and tending to others there is also a majority of people who are not too kind and are almost annoying to deal with. Not only that sometimes quests can be a hassle because sometimes there is no one willing to join your party due to the fact that they have problems of their own, this being due to the fact that there are literally a ton of people who are above the level of a beginner so the beginners have to seek other beginners in order to form parties and complete quests. And finally, the social interface. I think it should be approved upon due to it being a hassle to add people you meet, be it they joined your party or they want you to join theirs. The fact that you have to type in someone's name in order to even send them a request is but an annoyance and a waste of game time. Would you really want to type out 'xXMLGquickscoper420blazeXx' to your search bar and then click 'Send Friend Request' everytime you want to add a new player to your ever growing list of companions and pals online! HELL NO! That is the thing that annoys me the most in this game....the overly complicated social interface...They got everything right on simple gameplay mechanics and amazing design of the game overall but the social comms are all way to messed up and complicated.   Anyways I hope you guys enjoyed this review and if you wouldnt mind please check out my profile for a youtube link for my channel where I do game reviews but with the use of my voice, I also do cosplay(occasionallty), and overall gaming content. Hope you guys have a fun time in Aura Kingdom and I wish you all good luck and happy fortune!

Review made 11/29/2015  Very generic anime themepark MMORPG. Just the way I liked it, but so sad that this game is dying. I'll just recommend this game even though the playerbase is steadilly depleting. Lemme give some pros and cons.  pros - Anime theme (it really appeals to a lot of ppl) - Generic MMO Gameplay (because this makes the game idiot proof and easy to just get hooked) - The game is quite easy. (this is a pro to me. Not everyone has time to learn all the little complexities of a game) - Not a 100% Pay2Win. Non cash charging players just need more luck and time.  cons - Generic MMO Gameplay (because people are also looking for something unique) - Grindfest (cuz that's how generic asian MMO's are) - Swarmed with bots ( god damn gold farmers man) - Very much gear based. - Laggy servers (wasn't like this back then) - Dying playerbase - Dated Graphics - etc.  The cons outweighs the pros, but I personally enjoyed it. Do I really recommend this game at its current state? No. Why did I still recommend it? Because I believe a good game that's dying is still worth giving a chance even just a little bit.

How Kujo Not Recommend 'Aura Kingdom'?  --  (My playthrough consisted of solely the bard class)  It's only fun for so long. The combat's servicable enough except there's no strategy in regards positioning in any class not focused with ranged attacks. When executing an ability it locks you in place (or into the animation) until it's finished, with only being able to auto-attack while moving. Many of the quests you'll be doing consist of clicking on the objective to set a path you can auto-follow to just talk to NPCs, which is where more than half of your experience comes from, instead of quests oriented with combat. In a bizzare mechanic about the game I noted, gliding to objectives was actually faster than using mounts, even though it's not automatic. When you hit Level 35, which will take roughly 15 hours, and have access to trading there's no real incentive to truding to higher levels aside from the class progression.  The soundtrack has one or two songs that stand out whilst the other's fufill their purpose, and the game fairs well enough graphically. The community's rather friendly and the customer support was relatively quickly when I needed my pass code to be reset, but I've had no experience with the paid aspect of the game. I suggest a title like Dragon's Nest instead.

I'm a bit iffy on this one, to be honest. Overall, it's a nice enough little game - the graphics are pretty (particularly once you figure out how to get them scaled back from 640x480 pixels) and the story, while linear as all get-out, is pretty easy to follow. The community, such as I could see of it (bearing in mind I'm an Australian in time zone GMT+8, so I'm effectively about 8 hours out of synch with most of the English-speaking world) seemed friendly enough. It's an MMO you can just as easily play solo - while there are some parts where you need to be part of a group, they're not compulsory.   All that said, it has one big problem - botting. If you go into the game, you will see a lot of characters who look remarkably similar - all male, all wearing the first face, first hairstyle, and first hair colour (in other words, short purple hair) and all Grenadiers. They'll all have the same guardian spirit (usually Sigrun, after about level 25) and they'll turn up at certain spots  en masse . Their names will be random strings of characters, because they're bots. If you happen to be trying to level in a spot which has been botted, you're going to find yourself struggling to find the mob you're supposed to be killing, or the item you're supposed to be looking for, or the character you're supposed to be escorting, because the bots are there knee deep, and all you can do is wait for them to move on, and hope everything re-spawns before the next bot wave comes through.  The game also suffers from what appears to be a common problem to many MMO games - a single spawn point, a single storyline, and as a result the whole thing gets incredibly boring when you're running through the whole thing again in order to try out a different character class (really, though, the only MMOs I've run across which don't have this problem are World of Warcraft, and to a lesser extent, Dark Age of Camelot and City of Heroes). This is only exacerbated by the highly linear storyline, which doesn't have many side quests available.  Plus, of course, there's the standard anime problem of what the female characters are almost wearing. One day a game design company is going to realise approximately 50% of the world's population isn't overwhelmingly interested in looking at characters with improbably bouncy breasts (either because breasts just don't do it for them, or because they have a set of breasts themselves, or both) and they're going to realise there's an un-tapped market for eye-candy just waiting to be exploited. The designers of this game have got part of the way there - the male character models are very pretty, very bishie, and very cute to look at. But quite frankly, when the female version of an outfit regularly comes to a packet of dental floss, three sequins and a cork (you figure out where each goes) while the male version of the same outfit covers the character from chin to toes, it gets a bit annoying. Speak to the designers at Square Enix, for crying out loud - they at least accept there are more people playing games out there than just heterosexual men, and they provide some eye candy for the gay men and heterosexual women as well!  Really, it isn't a bad game. But then again, it doesn't really stand out in my mind as particularly good either. If Steam had an option for 'eeeehhhh...' I'd probably choose that. But as it stands, it's getting approximately 4.99/10, and voted down.
